text: How can we check the status of a node to confirm that it's operational?

elements.text: How can we check the status of a node to confirm that it's operational?

text:
you can grab the metrics from the validator node. I use this `splice_store_last_ingested_record_time_ms` , it should be less than 15 mins compare to current time.
<https://docs.sync.global/deployment/observability/metrics.html>

elements.text: you can grab the metrics from the validator node. I use this
splice_store_last_ingested_record_time_ms
, it should be less than 15 mins compare to current time.

text: <@U075X4TTWMP> the fact that your validator is up for 1h+ is a good sign. It usually "bootloops" every 3min or so if it can't connect to 2/3 of SVs for example

elements.text: the fact that your validator is up for 1h+ is a good sign. It usually "bootloops" every 3min or so if it can't connect to 2/3 of SVs for example

text: thanks <@U036PEBBNMC> the metrics is less than 15 mins

elements.text: thanks
the metrics is less than 15 mins

text:
Thanks for the clarification! That’s reassuring to hear. I’ll continue monitoring it, but it’s good to know that staying up for over an hour means it’s likely connected properly to the SVs.
Let me know if there’s anything else I should watch for.  <@U01TZB7MFFA>

elements.text:

text: Hello. Question about Postgresql support. For Validator and SV, all docs speak about PG14, which would be end of life in Nov 11 2026. Is that minimal required version or only supported one ?

elements.text: Hello. Question about Postgresql support. For Validator and SV, all docs speak about PG14, which would be end of life in Nov 11 2026. Is that minimal required version or only supported one ?

text: Well, my Validators were deployed with self managed PG16. And for SV, I have PG17 (CloudSQL)

elements.text: Well, my Validators were deployed with self managed PG16. And for SV, I have PG17 (CloudSQL)

text: But early so could still change

elements.text: But early so could still change

text: We're also using external PG 16, no issue so far

elements.text: We're also using external PG 16, no issue so far

text: OK, so no issue with using the newest available version on our ENV. Thanks

elements.text: OK, so no issue with using the newest available version on our ENV. Thanks

text: We've met a small issue with the newer versions of PostgreSQL (>14 iirc) in the past but it has been fixed in Splice and no issues since.

elements.text: We've met a small issue with the newer versions of PostgreSQL (>14 iirc) in the past but it has been fixed in Splice and no issues since.

text: Just for history: this change in PostgreSQL caused the issue we faced at that time <https://github.com/postgres/postgres/commit/2549f0661bd28571d7200d6f82f752a7ee5d47e1>

elements.text: Just for history: this change in PostgreSQL caused the issue we faced at that time
